awd_titl_txt: Electoluminescent Devices Based on Organmetallic Membranes
awd_abstract_narration: This grant is to fund a research project to develop                             multicolor thin film electroluminescent devices.                                The key to achieving high brightness and efficiency                             is the use of a new class of luminescent                                        organometallic lanthanide complexes as emitter                                  materials.  Band widths as narrow as 10 nm csan be                              achieved using Tb+3 and Eu+3 complexes.                                         Efficient injection type thin film electroluminescent                           devices require electron and hole injecting materials                           with low and high work functions respectively.  By                              using organic hole conductors and alkali metal                                  alloys as electron injectors, it will be possible to                            develop electroluminescent devices of high rightness                            and contrast for multicolor flat plate displays.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
